title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.2: SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: National and sub-national government partners have strengthened institutional capacities to develop and deliver child-sensitive social protection, particularly to children and families in the most-vulnerable situations, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more disadvantaged and excluded children are benefiting from an improved policy environment and strengthened social protection system

participating-org.narrative: COMM OF SOCIAL SAFETY AND POVERTY REDUCTION
DG SOCIAL WELFARE & DEV - RED SEA
MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC PLANNING KHARTOUM
MINISTRY OF WELFARE AND SOCIAL SECURITY MOSSW
STATE MINISTRY OF HEALTH RED SEA
STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL WELFARE KA

mailing-address.narrative: Gerief west [Manshiya] block # First District H Plots numbers 6/3

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national government partners have strengthened institutional capacities to develop and deliver child-sensitive social protection, particularly to children and families in the most-vulnerable situations

description.narrative: UNICEF scaled up its work and support to national partners in social policy and social protection as children and families across Sudan experienced increasing vulnerability in the face of major economic and political crisis. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of children from poorest and vulnerable families benefiting of UNICEF-supported social child cash grant transfers
Mother and children have access to Cash transfer interventions in the most vulnerable areas
Number of key Government staff with strengthened skills on social protection
Number of households benefitting from new or additional social assistance measures provided by governments to respond to COVID-19 with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Availability of an updated and functional information management system to follow-up and monitor the social protection delivery
2.8 M and E: Monitoring and evaluation mechanisms are used to follow up on social protection delivery/system
2.2 Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2020:Strategy development process initiated. Technical expertise by a top institution in social protection engaged and the TOR developed.

title.narrative: Annual Analysis of Child-Sensitive Budget and Child focus Public Expenditure Review available for the four main sectors (Education, Health & Nutrition, WASH and Child protection sectors)
